website_summaries.verdict: The best diving computer available to beginners and professionals alike looking for an easy-to-use solution.
pros: Watch functions are easy to navigate underwater using the built-in buttons to move through the menus
Dive data can be quickly transferred to a computer, where the information is automatically formatted
cons: Dive data cannot be accessed from the computer itself and requires an additional cable

customer_reviews.title: One long dive trip, totally happy.
customer_reviews.text: Everything I would want from a nitrox capable computer. Not super conservative. Studies have shown that super conservative computer have no better track record. So why be the person on the edge of deco when everyone else is down there enjoying their dive? My only complaint is the menu and setting nitrox is quite a bit more complicated than my Suunto.
customer_reviews.author: hankthecowdog

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Thanks All American Adventure Gear for shipping me a dead watch... I now need to buy a replacement battery and gasket and conduct a battery change... Not such a big deal, except my flight to Bali is tomorrow and I planned my day to learn the details of this watch.
customer_reviews.author: DazedandConfusedin2015

customer_reviews.title: No manufacture assistance.
customer_reviews.text: No support from manufacture, DVD goes to broken link on their website, their website has no support on how to use the watch. Manual is confusing and not helpful. Contact made with manufacture goes unanswered.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely in LOVE! I lusted over this for a year before finally stashing enough cash to buy it. Easy to use, easy to read. Fits nicely on a female wrist. I'm in a dive club with about 100 members, a good 60% have this one, in a variety of colors and are happy with it too. I dive 30-50 dives per year, so for my usage its awesome.
customer_reviews.author: S313

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: Difficult interface. Hard to see and no existing customer service from Oceanic if you need help. Also no computer attachment. Must pay additional $100 for cord.
customer_reviews.author: bkmobile

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I've used the computer during 3 dives and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've used the computer during 3 dives and it's just amazing. Very user-friendly. Alarms works according the settings, numbers and indicators are very easy to read under the water. Loving my computer. By the way even when it's watch style I think the size is a little big to wear it as everyday watch. Thanks LeisurePro for another excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Flores Juan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect entry level computer
customer_reviews.text: If like me, you want an affordable entry level computer that supports Nitrox and doesn't use RGBM, this is a great choice. Screen is super easy to read in the water. Menus and general use are super intuitive, the manual is well put together. Only real gripe is the ascent rate indicator: it extrapolates too aggressively based on too little history and gets mad at you for perfectly reasonable ascents.
customer_reviews.author: Washington Irving

customer_reviews.title: Dive computer
customer_reviews.text: I have a console computer with a pressure gauge and depth gauge that i just love, the Geo 2.0 i use as a backup to my standard computer, the size is so much smaller then my SUNTO Zoop. it's more of a comfort being able to double check your dive time and safty stop with ease.
customer_reviews.author: William K.

customer_reviews.title: Great low profile dive computer
customer_reviews.text: Great dive computer. I have used it on 10 dives now, and starting to get familiar with it. I really like the size of it. It is small enough it could almost pass as a normal watch, while most other computers are massive!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Cash

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic watch. Lots of great features and works as ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic watch. Lots of great features and works as advertised. A lot of the reviews say that this watch it too complicated, however, if you understand Nitrox, PO2 and O2 saturation, everything makes sense. The menus aren't that hard to navigate, however, I am a rather tech savy person.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sloyer

customer_reviews.title: It is not working anymore
customer_reviews.text: I did only about 30 dives and It is not working properly anymore, It enter in dive mode while in surface, beeps all day long and change the modes by itself. When tried to use in a dive after it starts, It was measuring anything properly and It was beeping the entire dive.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Tracks my depth, time and nitrogen saturation simply and clearly
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, tracks my depth, time and nitrogen saturation simply and clearly. I also like the alarms and the digital depth gauge which make it far easier to hover at 15 feet for the 3 minute stop -- this was nearly impossible to do with an analog gauge.
customer_reviews.author: Randy L

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic dive computer/watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific watch. If you want to use all of its capabilities, you'll need to read the manual. But programming it to tell time (dual time zones) and do basic diving is very intuitive. My first dive trip with the watch, the dive master used this instead of his own dive computer. It keeps track of individual dives, residual nitrogen, maximum depth, lifetime dives like a dream. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Avila

customer_reviews.title: Great value as a back up or in addition to analog gauge
customer_reviews.text: Great value, good visibility, I had some problems figuring out how to change some settings and the instruction was too general without detailed description. Worked very well for me as a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Marek Wasaznik

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, after replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of them for me and my wife. One turned out great, the other had problems with the altitude sensor and thermometer. I sent it back and the people at Prime Scuba were great and helped me a lot to get a new replacement. We've used the good one for 8 dives in Cozumel and San Carlos, Sonora, and it has worked great. The replacement also did a good job on 3 dives at Sonora, I hope it stays that way. The PC/Mac interphase is awesome. What I don't like that much is that the USB cable is very expensive to be just a cable, and the printed manual is not clear.
customer_reviews.author: Ezequiel Elizalde

customer_reviews.title: amazing dive computer
customer_reviews.text: One of the best investments I've made in my life
customer_reviews.author: Kareem N.

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work after mi fourth dive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this computer last december; made 4 dives and worked well, but in my fifth dive, last week, the computer didn't work properly and now I have an expesive watch
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is a smaller watch in comparison with other dive watches which is nice. Is easy to read when diving
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch for my husband. I have to say, he loves it. Is a smaller watch in comparison with other dive watches which is nice. Is easy to read when diving. It comes with instructions on how to use as instructional videos. Awesome buy.
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore and Jessenia

customer_reviews.title: Functioned correctly, but not intuitive to use, and documentation could be better.
customer_reviews.text: Understanding the function took a while, and for me, it was not easy. The documentation required careful re-reading multiple times. It would be helpful to have the instructions for use re-written in a more basic style.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this device. Bought it for my daughter who dives and she loves it. She feels much safer diving with it. Excellent price compared to other places I looked.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Leaked and ruined on first dive with battery back and washer in.
customer_reviews.text: This product leaked on first use diving. Don’t buy from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: jason ehlers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Good computer/easy to use/easy to change battery Best shape/reasonable price
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Yassien

customer_reviews.title: Geo 2
customer_reviews.text: It looks amazing. It works just like I expected it to. I love the fact that I can wear it everyday as a a regular watch. Learning to navigate the functions is a bit tricky but was well worth the money I spent.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: VALUE FOR MONEY both for experienced and new divers
customer_reviews.text: tried the oceanic geo 2.0 fits my wrist perfectly and could be worn as an ordinary wristwatch.. the blue light comes in handy..and so easy to read the display
customer_reviews.author: ERWIN DELA TORRE

customer_reviews.title: Great dive computer
customer_reviews.text: I broke it in on the Antilla, Jane Sea, Arashi Reef and Phil's Choice dives in Aruba. The dive computer performed flawlessly. Once I actually took the time to read through the manual navigating the dive computer's menu system was a no brainer. I will suggest though that if you buy this dive computer you read the manual AND take their online course. I'll end up retaking it once I switch to nitrox and have to juggle air mixtures.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Solid dive computer
customer_reviews.text: 6 logged dives on it so far. No issues reading it under water and it functions how I would expect. On land it's smaller size makes it look and feel more like a normal watch.
customer_reviews.author: breg

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great looking dive computer
customer_reviews.text: Great value, great looking dive computer. A little complicated to use at first, but the manuals online make everything clear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very good dive computer for the price
customer_reviews.text: The menu is initially complicated but soon becomes obvious. Very easy to set the different gas pressures. Underwater very clear display. Ascent warning is very useful and the safety stop timer clear
customer_reviews.author: Helen Walton

customer_reviews.title: achieved my expectation
customer_reviews.text: very good, works very well and it is very easy to manage all the dives and information related.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Paula Fernandes Montanha

customer_reviews.title: Great computer. The only problem is the wrist that ...
customer_reviews.text: Great computer. The only problem is the wrist that has broken and there is any place to buy a new one. Replacing for a adapted one.
customer_reviews.author: RBS

customer_reviews.title: Poor set up info
customer_reviews.text: Poor set up information. If you want a video to set up they charge you. Not acceptable. It ruins the whole aspect of the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the Mac-Dive software
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Dive Watch. small enough to wear all vacation and works well with the Mac-Dive software. I may just wear it more often to remind me of my dives ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Tech Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great watch and dive computer
customer_reviews.text: Great dive computer, so far so good. Had a few dives and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Delivery on time! The only small thing I would say is the color isn't as dark as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Chia-Hsin Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great product, very light and small
customer_reviews.text: Great product,very light and small. Easy to use and professional. Impossible not to hear/see if you are reaching your limits under water!! Not much on the conservative side, which is good if you enjoy staying for another minute :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great gear. Nice to wear as watch. A way to save battery (sleep mode) will be a must.
customer_reviews.author: Joneval Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Very complicated to work
customer_reviews.text: Nice watch, the only problem is there are no instructions on how to operate the computer. Very complicated and very little direction on how to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M Hall

customer_reviews.title: Not that friendly
customer_reviews.text: The function of the Geo 2.0 computer is not that friendly as they say. It is difficult to find all the features as log book or even the settings after you change the battery. The users manual inside the package is very basic and the online version is not easy to find. Finally I asked the Slate Blue versión (as it looks in the picture of thes review.. and they sent me the silver version. I don't recommend this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Santi

customer_reviews.title: I really like it. It came with an online training class ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this computer for a couple of months now and have done 14 dives with it. I really like it. It came with an online training class that helped teach how it works. This helped with the instructions, which are not great. I am able to switch anything I need to on the watch after learning the different steps from the training. I also like this computer because it's a watch size and doesn't have a long, one size fits all, strap. I have small wrists so this is still a little big on me but the strap does not hang off the watch - so it doesn't get caught on every little thing.
customer_reviews.author: Brodie

customer_reviews.title: 5 dives in and I am a happy man
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Very durable. All the information you would need for recreational diving. My one gripe is the user interface. This device is far from intuitive and you definitely need to sit through the online course (comes with the purchase) before you go for your dives. The menus are complicated and leave much to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: turkz1

customer_reviews.title: Excellent PDC for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use this computer as a backup to my Atom 3.1. Excellent PDC for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Diver2

customer_reviews.title: what a successful Dive Computer
customer_reviews.text: every thing i need is inside this dive comp. exept the Compass. easy to use it come with 2 manuel and 1 CD, but the one thing missed is the cable for connecting the dive comp with the PC =( it suppose to came with the carton :\\\
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad M. A. Almatouq

customer_reviews.title: Great Dive Computer
customer_reviews.text: Bought the GEO 2.0 prior to a trip to St Martin. I am new to scuba diving having been certified only 6 months ago. Four dives later, the GEO has definitely met my expectation providing all the necessary information under water and marking safety stops as appropriate. The menus are not necessarily intuitive so reading the user manual prior to diving was key, in order to understand all the functionality provided by the GEO.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Great dive computer
customer_reviews.text: Great dive computer. Did a Pacific live aboard and the dive masters and several of the divers had a similar model and were able to help with some settings. Numbers a good size and looks good on, with street clothes. I am a woman! Can't say enough about this watch and will buy as gift for that special dive buddy.
customer_reviews.author: Trimarianne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Recommended. Excellent Quality. Quick manual and CD includes as well as screen protection that's easy to apply. *****
customer_reviews.author: Barbara  P.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Original computer flooded on a dive. I got a replacement (customer service was excellent). After two months the stop watch on the replacement stopped working. Various other simple functions went awry. And I'm supposed to trust the thing for far more complicated tasks? Sorry, no more Oceanic for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great as a dive watch and time watch. easy to see display.
customer_reviews.author: KVVK

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this computer, the instructions on how to operate it was too complicated and not user friendly. I'm sure it is a great computer, but not for someone like me when my time is limited. I need a easy to see, easy to operate, and user friendlly device. :(
customer_reviews.author: Debra King

product_meta.title: Oceanic GEO 2.0 Wrist Computer Watch
product_meta.description: The Geo 2.0 includes Dual Algorithm, Deep Stop option and a redesigned user interface with "Step Back" â€“ which allows forward and backward navigation through menus and settings. Additionally, a second Nitrox mix (both programmable to 100%) is available, as well as Firmware Auto-Update which allows the user to download and install operational improvements or even future new features through the PC Interface (with optional cable). With Dual Algorithm and optional conservative factor settings, the Geo 2.0 may be programmed to provide no-deco and deco profiles similar to virtually every computer on the market.
feature_bullets: Powered by Oceanic's Exclusive Dual Algorithm - Your choice between Pelagic DSAT (Spencer/Powell data basis) or Pelagic Z+ (Buhlmann ZHL-16C data basis)
4 Operating Modes: WATCH (Alternate Time, Chrono, Daily Alarm, Countdown Timer), NORM (Air and Nitrox), GAUGE (with run timer) and FREE (tracks calculations to allow switching between NORM and Free)

User-Friendly Interface with "Step Back" – allows forward and backward navigation through menus and settings - Switch between up to 2 Nitrox mixes to 100% O2 with no restriction (Gas 1 may be up to 100%, and may be less or greater than Gas 2)
Stop times 3 minutes - displays minutes & seconds - Deep Stop with Countdown Timer – Maybe turned on or off. 2 minute countdown at half your max depth, for dives greater than 80 ft / 25m

Single button access to "Last Dive" display (max depth & bottom time) - Data Retention - maintains calculations indefinitely when the battery is changed - Audible Alarm with flashing LED light - History Mode includes total number of dives, max depth, total dive hours, and lowest temp

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
